newsitem.title: JAPAN: Softbank to issue shares, bonds - Jiji.
newsitem.headline: Softbank to issue shares, bonds - Jiji.

text.p: Softbank Corp will decide as early as on Tuesday on whether to issue new shares worth more than 40 billion yen and whether to issue 10 billion yen worth of domestic convertible bonds, Jiji news agency said on Tuesday.
The company declined to comment on any possible share or bond issues.

Jiji said Softbank would use the funds to be raised through the share and bond issues for a digital broadcasting project and for its purchase of shares in Asahi National Broadcasting Co, widely known as TV Asahi.
Earlier on Tuesday, some underwriting sources said Softbank was considering raising funds through a bond issue.
If the company decided on the bond issue, it would probably be an issue of about 10 billion yen of domestic convertible bonds, one source said.
